sen.j: 平群広成（へぐり の ひろなり、生年不詳 - 天平勝宝5年1月28日 (旧暦)（753年3月11日））は、奈良時代の遣唐使判官。
sen.e: HEGURI no Hironari (year of birth unknown - March 11, 753) was an administrative officer of the envoy to Tang China.
HEGURI no Hironari (year of birth unknown - March 11, 753) was the hangan (the third officer) of the envoys to Tang China in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: ①「遣唐使判官」の訳を修正しました。 ②「奈良時代の」の訳漏れ→補足しました。
sen.e: HEGURI no Hironari (year of birth unknown - March 11, 753) was the hangan (the third officer) of the envoys to Tang China in the Nara period.

sen.j: 平群氏。
sen.e: The Heguri clan.
The Heguri clan.
The Heguri clan.

sen.j: 讃岐国守平群豊万呂の子。
sen.e: He was a son of HEGURI no Toyomaro, Provincial Governor of Sanuki.
He was a son of HEGURI no Toyomaro, Sanuki no kuni no kami (Provincial Governor of Sanuki).
sen.cmt: 「讃岐国守」の直訳を追加しました。
sen.e: He was a son of HEGURI no Toyomaro, Sanuki no kuni no kami (Provincial Governor of Sanuki).

sen.j: 従四位・武蔵国守。
sen.e: Junior Fourth Rank, Provincial Governor of Musashi
Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank), Musashi no kuni no kami (Provincial Governor of Musashi).
sen.cmt: それぞれ直訳を追加しました。
sen.e: Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank), Musashi no kuni no kami (Provincial Governor of Musashi).

sen.j: 正式なカバネ（かばね）は平群朝臣（へぐりのあそみ）。
sen.e: His official kabane title was HEGURI no Asomi.
His kabane (hereditary title) was HEGURI no Asomi.
sen.cmt: 「カバネ」の訳を含むように変更しました。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was HEGURI no Asomi.

sen.j: 遣唐使として唐に渡るが、帰国の途中難船。
sen.e: He went over to Tang China as a Japanese envoy to the Tang dynasty, but he was shipwrecked on his way home.
He went over to Tang Dynasty China as a Japanese envoy, but he was shipwrecked on his way home.
sen.cmt: 文前半の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: He went over to Tang Dynasty China as a Japanese envoy, but he was shipwrecked on his way home.

sen.j: はるか崑崙国（チャンパ王国）にまで漂流したが、無事生還し日本へ帰国した。
sen.e: The ship drifted to far to the Kingdom of Champa, but he succeeded in returning to Japan alive.
Although the ship drifted far to the Kingdom of Champa, he survived the shipwreck and returned to Japan.
sen.cmt: 文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Although the ship drifted far to the Kingdom of Champa, he survived the shipwreck and returned to Japan.

sen.j: 古代の日本人のなかで最も広い世界を見たとされる人物である。
sen.e: He is regarded as the ancient Japanese who had seen the most places in the world.
He is regarded as the one who had seen the most places in the world among the ancient Japanese.
sen.cmt: 文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: He is regarded as the one who had seen the most places in the world among the ancient Japanese.

sen.j: 神亀5年（728年）1月17日 (旧暦)日本海を越えてきた渤海 (国)の使節が初めて平城宮に入朝した。
sen.e: On March 6, 728, envoys from Bokkai came over the Sea of Japan visited the Heijokyu Palace for the first time.
On March 6, 728, the envoys from Bokkai (Balhae) sailed across the Sea of Japan and visited the Heijo-kyu Palace for the first time.
sen.cmt: 文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: On March 6, 728, the envoys from Bokkai (Balhae) sailed across the Sea of Japan and visited the Heijo-kyu Palace for the first time.

sen.j: 渤海の使節は前年9月に蝦夷地に漂着し、大使・高仁義ら16名は蝦夷に襲われて死亡、首領・高斉徳ら8名が生き残って出羽国に助けを求めたものであった。
sen.e: In September 727, the envoys from Bokkai drifted ashore Ezochi; 16 among them including the ambassador Ko Jingi were attacked and killed by the Ezo people, and 8 among them including the chieftain Ko Seitoku survived and reached Dewa Province, asking for help.

In September the year before, the envoys from Bokkai washed ashore in Ezochi (inhabited area of Ainu); 16 people including the ambassador Ko Jingi were attacked and killed by the Ezo (the Ainu people), and 8 others including the chieftain Ko Seitoku survived and reached Dewa Province, asking for help.
sen.cmt: 文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In September the year before, the envoys from Bokkai washed ashore in Ezochi (inhabited area of Ainu); 16 people including the ambassador Ko Jingi were attacked and killed by the Ezo (the Ainu people), and 8 others including the chieftain Ko Seitoku survived and reached Dewa Province, asking for help.

sen.j: 彼らが提出した渤海郡王大武芸の国書には、渤海を高句麗の再興であると宣言し、日本との友好善隣を求めていた。
sen.e: The survivors submitted a diplomatic message by guno Bungei DAI of Bokkai, in which Bungei declared that Koguryo restored as Bokkai and wanted to establish friendship and good neighbor relations with Japan.

The survivors presented the Imperial Court with a diplomatic message from guno (a second highest rank of the court rank) Bugei DAI (Dae Muye) of Bokkai, in which Bugei declared that Bokkai was established after the fall of Koguryo and that asked for good neighbor relations with Japan.
sen.cmt: 文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: The survivors presented the Imperial Court with a diplomatic message from guno (a second highest rank of the court rank) Bugei DAI (Dae Muye) of Bokkai, in which Bugei declared that Bokkai was established after the fall of Koguryo and that asked for good neighbor relations with Japan.

sen.j: かつて日本とも交流のあった高句麗は668年唐・新羅連合軍に滅ぼされていたが、その遺民が再び国を起こしたのであった。
sen.e: Koguryo, which had cultural exchanges with Japan, defeated by the allied forces of Tang China and Silla in 668, and the surviving people established a country.
Koguryo, which had cultural exchanges with Japan, was defeated by the Silla-Tang allied forces in 668; however, the surviving people established the country again.
sen.cmt: ①「高句麗」が主語なのでbe動詞を入れ受身の文としました。 ②従属節は逆接であると思います。
sen.e: Koguryo, which had cultural exchanges with Japan, was defeated by the Silla-Tang allied forces in 668; however, the surviving people established the country again.

sen.j: 日本としては慶賀すべきことで、早速引田虫麻呂が送渤海使に任命され、高斉徳らを送還するために渤海に向かった。
sen.e: It was a matter for celebration for Japan so that HIKETA no Mushimaro was appointed the envoy to Bokkai at once and headed for Bokkai to send the survivors including Ko Seitoku.
It was a matter for celebration for Japan; HIKETA no Mushimaro was appointed the envoy to Bokkai at once and headed for Bokkai to send the survivors including Ko Seitoku back home.
sen.cmt: 文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: It was a matter for celebration for Japan; HIKETA no Mushimaro was appointed the envoy to Bokkai at once and headed for Bokkai to send the survivors including Ko Seitoku back home.

sen.j: 引田虫麻呂は天平2年（730年）8月29日 (旧暦)帰朝し、渤海王の進物や国書を携えてきたが、渤海王から日渤の軍事同盟を持ちかけられてきた形跡がある。
sen.e: On October 19, 730, HIKETA no Mushimaro returned to Japan with gifts and a diplomatic message from the king of Bokkai; it is considered that Mushimaro brought back the offer of military alliance between Japan and Bokkai from the king of Bokkai.

On October 19, 730, HIKETA no Mushimaro returned to Japan with gifts and a diplomatic message from the king of Bokkai; it is considered that Mushimaro brought back the offer of military alliance between Japan and Bokkai from the king of Bokkai.

On October 19, 730, HIKETA no Mushimaro returned to Japan with gifts and a diplomatic message from the king of Bokkai; it is considered that Mushimaro brought back the offer of military alliance between Japan and Bokkai from the king of Bokkai.

sen.j: 当時、大武芸は唐に亡命した弟・大門芸をめぐって唐と対立しており、一触即発の状態にあった。
sen.e: In those days, Bugei DAI conflicted with Tang China over his younger brother Mongei DAI, who had exiled himself to Tang China, which brought Bokkai and Tang China to a hair-trigger situation.
In those days, Bugei DAI was opposed to Tang China over his younger brother Mongei DAI (Dae Munye), who had exiled himself to Tang China, creating a hair-trigger situation.
sen.cmt: 対立しているという状態を表す表現に変更し、文後半の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In those days, Bugei DAI was opposed to Tang China over his younger brother Mongei DAI (Dae Munye), who had exiled himself to Tang China, creating a hair-trigger situation.

sen.j: 唐と開戦するとすれば、渤海南辺の新羅が唐に加担するのは明らかである。
sen.e: If Japan were to start a war against Tang China, Silla, the Southern neighbor of Bokkai, would undoubtedly support Tang China.
If waging war against Tang China, it was obvious that Silla, the Southern neighbor of Bokkai, would support Tang China.
sen.cmt: 唐と開戦する国がどこを指すのか明らかではない（恐らく渤海を指している）ため訳を変更しました。
sen.e: If waging war against Tang China, it was obvious that Silla, the Southern neighbor of Bokkai, would support Tang China.

sen.j: このため大武芸は日本を引き込むことで、新羅の動きを牽制しようとしたとされている。
sen.e: It is considered that Bugei DAI tried to forestall Silla by forming an alliance with Japan.
It is considered that Bugei DAI tried to contain Silla by forming an alliance with Japan.
sen.cmt: 「牽制する」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: It is considered that Bugei DAI tried to contain Silla by forming an alliance with Japan.

sen.j: 三国史記には翌731年日本国兵船300隻が新羅東辺を襲うとある。
sen.e: Sangoku shiki has a record that 300 Japanese warships attacked the east side of Silla in 731.
The Sangoku shiki (or Samguk Sagi, History of the Three Kingdoms) contains a record of 300 Japanese warships attacking the east side of Silla in 731.
sen.cmt: 文章全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: The Sangoku shiki (or Samguk Sagi, History of the Three Kingdoms) contains a record of 300 Japanese warships attacking the east side of Silla in 731.

sen.j: 日本側には新羅攻撃の史料がないが、渤海の出現により日本と新羅の関係が緊張したのは事実である。
sen.e: Although no historical sources have been found in Japan to confirm the attack on Silla, it was a fact that the appearance of Bokkai caused the tense between Japan and Silla.
Although no historical sources have been found in Japan to confirm the attack on Silla, it was true that the appearance of Bokkai caused the tension between Japan and Silla.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Although no historical sources have been found in Japan to confirm the attack on Silla, it was true that the appearance of Bokkai caused the tension between Japan and Silla.

sen.j: 天平4年（732年）1月22日 (旧暦)、角家主が遣新羅使として派遣され、8月11日 (旧暦)帰国するが、家主帰国後の日本側の動きが慌しい。
sen.e: On February 26, 732, TSUNU no Ienushi was sent to Silla as an envoy and returned to Japan on September 8, after which a flurry of activity went on in the Japanese government.
On February 26, 732, TSUNU no Ienushi was sent to Silla as an envoy and returned to Japan on September 8, after which there was a flurry of activity in the Japanese government.
sen.cmt: 角家主=TSUNU no Ienushi の確認ができませんでした。
sen.e: On February 26, 732, TSUNU no Ienushi was sent to Silla as an envoy and returned to Japan on September 8, after which there was a flurry of activity in the Japanese government.

sen.j: 余程重大な情報がもたらされたと考えられる。
sen.e: It is supposed that very important information was brought by Ienushi.
It was considered that extremely important information was brought by Ienushi.
sen.cmt: 時制の変更と文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: It was considered that extremely important information was brought by Ienushi.

sen.j: というのも8月18日 (旧暦)には遣唐使発遣が決定され、同時に朝廷の高官が東海道、東山道、山陰道、西海道各道の節度使に任命された。
sen.e: This is partly because the Japanese government decided to dispatch envoys to Tang China and appointed high-ranking officials of the Imperial Court to regional military governors of Tokaido, Tosando, Sanindo, and Saikaido on September 15.

This is partly because that, on September 15, the Japanese government decided to dispatch envoys to Tang China and, at the same time, appointed high-ranking officials of the Imperial Court to regional military governors of the Tokai-do Road, the Tosan-do Road, the Sanin-do Road, and the Saikai-do Road.
sen.cmt: 「同時に」の訳を入れたため8月18日（旧暦）の訳を文前半に移動しました。
sen.e: This is partly because that, on September 15, the Japanese government decided to dispatch envoys to Tang China and, at the same time, appointed high-ranking officials of the Imperial Court to regional military governors of the Tokai-do Road, the Tosan-do Road, the Sanin-do Road, and the Saikai-do Road.

sen.j: 8月22日 (旧暦)には兵士の充足と軍備の充実が命じられているからである。
sen.e: And also partly because it was ordered to reinforce troops and enhance armaments on September 19.
Also, on September 19, it was ordered to reinforce troops and enhance armaments.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Also, on September 19, it was ordered to reinforce troops and enhance armaments.

sen.j: 新羅で唐と渤海の開戦が近いことを知った日本は参戦の決意を固め、その前に前回の遣唐使が残した留学生や留学僧を帰国させようとしたと考えられる。
sen.e: The Japanese government, which recognized in Silla that a war was about to break out between China and Bokkai, decided to participate in the war, and supposedly managed to evacuate Japanese students and monks, who went over China by the previous vessels of Japanese envoys to China.

It was considered that when the Japanese government found out about the upcoming war in Silla between Tang China and Bokkai, it decided to participate in the war, but before that it managed to evacuate Japanese students and monks, who were left behind in Tang China after the previous envoys came back to Japan.
sen.cmt: 「唐」の訳をTang Chinaに直し、文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: It was considered that when the Japanese government found out about the upcoming war in Silla between Tang China and Bokkai, it decided to participate in the war, but before that it managed to evacuate Japanese students and monks, who were left behind in Tang China after the previous envoys came back to Japan.

sen.j: その証拠にこの時の遣唐使には新たな留学生・僧が派遣された形跡がない。
sen.e: That is proved by the fact that neither students nor monks were sent with the envoys at that time.
In fact, neither new students nor monks were sent together with the envoys at that time.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In fact, neither new students nor monks were sent together with the envoys at that time.

tit.e: The Japanese envoys to Tang China
The Japanese envoys to Tang China

sen.j: 平群広成はこのような背景のもとに、派遣が決定された遣唐使節の判官に任命された。
sen.e: Under the circumstances, HEGURI no Hironari was appointed the third officer of the envoy to Tang China.
Under the circumstances, HEGURI no Hironari was appointed the hangan for the envoys who were decided to be sent to Tang China.
sen.cmt: 「派遣が決定された」の訳を追加し、文の流れを変えました。
sen.e: Under the circumstances, HEGURI no Hironari was appointed the hangan for the envoys who were decided to be sent to Tang China.

sen.j: これ以前の広成の経歴は知られていない。
sen.e: The career of HEGURI no Hironari before this appointment is unknown.
Hironari's previous career is unknown.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Hironari's previous career is unknown.

sen.j: 平群氏は大和国西北部の平群郡を根拠地とし、5世紀の頃には国政を左右するような大臣を出したこともあるが、この頃には中級の官人となり、諸国の国司などを勤める家柄になっている。
sen.e: The Heguri clan established Heguri-gun County in the north part of Yamato Province as their base, and during the fifth century, produced a minister who was so powerful as to influence over the state affairs; in the days of Hironari, the clan had become the house of middle-ranking officials, producing governors of several provinces.

The Heguri clan set up their base at Hegurino-kori in the northwestern part of Yamato Province, and during the fifth century, produced a minister who was so powerful as to influence over the state affairs; in the days of Hironari, the clan had become the house of middle-ranking officials, producing the governors of several provinces.
sen.cmt: 「大和国西北部の平群郡を根拠地とし」の訳を変更し文の流れを自然になるようにしました。
sen.e: The Heguri clan set up their base at Hegurino-kori in the northwestern part of Yamato Province, and during the fifth century, produced a minister who was so powerful as to influence over the state affairs; in the days of Hironari, the clan had become the house of middle-ranking officials, producing the governors of several provinces.

sen.j: 今回の遣唐大使には前回の大使多治比県守の弟、多治比広成が任命された。
sen.e: TAJIHI no Hironari, a younger brother of TAJIHI no Agatamori who was the previous ambassador to Tang China, was appointed the ambassador to Tang China this time.
TAJIHI no Hironari, a younger brother of TAJIHI no Agatamori who was the previous ambassador to Tang China, was appointed the ambassador to Tang China this time.
TAJIHI no Hironari, a younger brother of TAJIHI no Agatamori who was the previous ambassador to Tang China, was appointed the ambassador to Tang China this time.

sen.j: 県守はこの時、中納言の要職にあり、山陰道節度使にも任命されている。
sen.e: Agatamori served as Middle Counselor, an important post of government, and was also appointed regional military governor of Sanindo.
Agatamori, at that time, served as Chunagon (Middle Counselor), an important position in the government, and was also appointed a military governor of the Sanin-do Road.
sen.cmt: 「山陰道節度使」の固有名詞を使用するのでregionalは不要かと思われます。
sen.e: Agatamori, at that time, served as Chunagon (Middle Counselor), an important position in the government, and was also appointed a military governor of the Sanin-do Road.

sen.j: 副使には朝廷の祭祀を職掌とする中臣家から名代が任命されている。
sen.e: As vice-ambassador, NAKATOMI no Nashiro, who had assumed the official duty of religious service of the Imperial Court, was appointed.
Nashiro, from the NAKATOMI family who were officially engaged in performing a religious service for the Imperial Court, was appointed a vice-ambassador.
sen.cmt: 「中臣家から名代」の訳を含め、文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Nashiro, from the NAKATOMI family who were officially engaged in performing a religious service for the Imperial Court, was appointed a vice-ambassador.

sen.j: 他に判官（参事官）4名、録事（書記官）4名が任命された。
sen.e: Four administrative officers (councilors) and four secretaries were appointed.
In addition, four hangan (counsellors) and four rokuji (officials administering affairs of secretary under the ritsuryo system) (secretaries) were appointed.
sen.cmt: 文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In addition, four hangan (counsellors) and four rokuji (officials administering affairs of secretary under the ritsuryo system) (secretaries) were appointed.

sen.j: 平群広成はこの判官4人のひとりに選ばれたのである。
sen.e: HEGURI no Hironari was selected as one of the four administrative officers.
HEGURI no Hironari was selected as one of four hangan.
sen.cmt: 「判官」の訳を前述の訳に合わせました。
sen.e: HEGURI no Hironari was selected as one of four hangan.

sen.j: しかし、遣唐使を派遣するにはまず船の建造から始める必要があった。
sen.e: For dispatching the envoys, the vessels needed to be constructed first.
For dispatching the envoys, however, the vessels needed to be constructed first.
sen.cmt: 「しかし」（逆接）の訳を追加しました。
sen.e: For dispatching the envoys, however, the vessels needed to be constructed first.

sen.j: 9月4日 (旧暦)、近江国、丹波国、播磨国、備中国などの諸国に遣唐使船4隻の建造が命じられている。
sen.e: On October 1, 732, the government ordered Omi Province, Tanba Province, Harima Province, and Bicchu Province to construct four vessels for the envoys to Tang China.
On October 1, 732, the government ordered Omi Province, Tanba Province, Harima Province, and Bicchu Province to construct four vessels for the envoys to Tang China.
On October 1, 732, the government ordered Omi Province, Tanba Province, Harima Province, and Bicchu Province to construct four vessels for the envoys to Tang China.

sen.j: 緊迫した情勢下での建造であるため、相当な突貫工事であったと思われる。
sen.e: Since the vessels were constructed in a very tense situation, it was supposedly a rush work.
Due to the tense situation, it seemed that the vessels were constructed in a rush.
sen.cmt: 文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Due to the tense situation, it seemed that the vessels were constructed in a rush.

sen.j: ともかく翌天平5年（733年）3月大使従四位上多治比広成はじめ派遣団は拝朝し、4月3日 (旧暦)4隻の船に分乗して難波津を進発した。
sen.e: In any case, in March 733, the embassy led by TAJIHI no Hironari, the ambassador, Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, visited the emperor of Japan, and on May 24, left the port of Naniwa no Tsu on the four vessels.

In any case, in March of next year, 733, the mission led by TAJIHI no Hironari, the ambassador, Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, visited the Imperial Court, and on May 24, they departed from the port of Naniwa no Tsu on four vessels.
sen.cmt: ①「派遣団」の訳を変更しました。 ②文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In any case, in March of next year, 733, the mission led by TAJIHI no Hironari, the ambassador, Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, visited the Imperial Court, and on May 24, they departed from the port of Naniwa no Tsu on four vessels.

sen.j: 途中東シナ海で嵐に遭ったが、なんとか4船無事に蘇州市の海岸に着岸した。
sen.e: The four vessels rode out a storm in the East China Sea and reached the shore of Suzhou City.
On the way, they were caught in a storm in the East China Sea; however, they safely managed to reach the shore in Suzhou City on four vessels.
sen.cmt: 人を主語とした文に置き換えました。
sen.e: On the way, they were caught in a storm in the East China Sea; however, they safely managed to reach the shore in Suzhou City on four vessels.

sen.j: 唐に着いた一行は前年、渤海水軍が山東の登州を攻撃したことを知っただろう。
sen.e: The embassy that reached Tang China must have heard that the navy of Bokkai had attacked Dengzhou of Shandong.
Upon arrival in Tang China, the party must have learned that the Bokkai navy had attacked Dengzhou in Shandong the previous year.
sen.cmt: ①文全体の流れを自然にしました。 ②「前年」の訳を補足しました。
sen.e: Upon arrival in Tang China, the party must have learned that the Bokkai navy had attacked Dengzhou in Shandong the previous year.

sen.j: すでに戦争は始まっていた。
sen.e: The war had already started.
The war had already started.
The war had already started.

sen.j: この年（開元21年）玄宗 (唐)は大門芸を幽州に派遣して兵を集めさせ、新羅王にも渤海攻撃を命じている。
sen.e: In 733, Genso of Tang China dispatched Mongei DAI to Yushu to collect an army, and also ordered the King of Silla to attack Bokkai.
In 733, Genso (Xuan Zong) of Tang China dispatched Mongei DAI to Yushu to form an army, and also ordered the King of Silla to attack Bokkai.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In 733, Genso (Xuan Zong) of Tang China dispatched Mongei DAI to Yushu to form an army, and also ordered the King of Silla to attack Bokkai.

sen.j: しかし、いずれも不調に終わった。
sen.e: But both of the orders were not achieved.
However, both attempts ended in failure.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: However, both attempts ended in failure.

sen.j: 唐の「冊府元亀」によれば、「開元22年（734年）4月日本国遣使来朝、美嚢絁（みのうのあしぎぬ）二百匹、水織絁（みずおりのあしぎぬ）二百匹を献ず。」とある。
sen.e: Sappu genki' compiled in Tang China describes that 'in the fourth month of the 22nd year of Kaigen era (734), the embassy came from Japan and presented 400 rolls of silk fabric called Minou no ashiginu and 400 rolls of silk fabric called Mizuori no ashiginu to the emperor.'

"Prime Tortoise of the Record Bureau" compiled in Tang China describes that 'in the fourth month of the 22nd year of Kaigen era (734), the envoys came from Japan and presented the emperor with 200 rolls of thick silk fabric called Mino no ashiginu and another 200 rolls of thick silk fabric called Mizuori no ashiginu.'
sen.cmt: 各「あしぎぬ」の数を200に訂正しました。
sen.e: "Prime Tortoise of the Record Bureau" compiled in Tang China describes that 'in the fourth month of the 22nd year of Kaigen era (734), the envoys came from Japan and presented the emperor with 200 rolls of thick silk fabric called Mino no ashiginu and another 200 rolls of thick silk fabric called Mizuori no ashiginu.'

sen.j: 蘇州到着から朝貢の儀まで1年近くを要しているので、一行は一時蘇州に留め置かれた可能性もある。
sen.e: It took one year for the embassy to bring the tribute to the emperor of Tang since they arrived at Suzhou, they were supposedly detained at Suzhou for a while.
Since it took almost one year for the party to give the tribute to the emperor of Tang China after their arrival in Suzhou City, they might have been detained there for a while.
sen.cmt: ①前文を接続節にしました。②「貢を与える」という意味なのでbringではなくgiveにしました。
sen.e: Since it took almost one year for the party to give the tribute to the emperor of Tang China after their arrival in Suzhou City, they might have been detained there for a while.

sen.j: いずれにしても、遣唐使一行は無事朝貢の役目を果たし、在唐の留学生、留学僧を集め、才能ある唐人などを日本に招いた。
sen.e: Anyway, the embassy successfully brought the tribute to the emperor of Tang, collected Japanese students and monks stayed there, and invited the Chinese with talents to Japan.
In any case, the party successfully gave the tribute to the emperor of Tang China, gathered the Japanese students and monks who remained there, and invited the gifted Chinese to Japan.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In any case, the party successfully gave the tribute to the emperor of Tang China, gathered the Japanese students and monks who remained there, and invited the gifted Chinese to Japan.

sen.j: この時、前回渡唐した吉備真備や玄ボウは帰国に応じたが、阿倍仲麻呂は科挙に合格して唐の官職に就任しており、帰国しなかった。
sen.e: At this time, KIBI no Makibi and Genbo, who went over to Tang by the previous vessels, agreed to return to Japan, but ABE no Nakamaro did not return to Japan because he had passed the kakyo examination and taken a government post of Tang.

At this time, KIBI no Makibi and Genbo, who visited Tang China on the previous vessels, agreed to return to Japan, but ABE no Nakamaro refused to do so because he had passed the kakyo (examinations for Chinese state bureaucrats) and taken the government post there.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: At this time, KIBI no Makibi and Genbo, who visited Tang China on the previous vessels, agreed to return to Japan, but ABE no Nakamaro refused to do so because he had passed the kakyo (examinations for Chinese state bureaucrats) and taken the government post there.

sen.j: 同年10月、一行は4隻の船に分乗、蘇州管内の港を出発して帰国の途に就いたが、東シナ海上の暴風雨に遭い、4船バラバラとなった。
sen.e: In the tenth month of the same year, the embassy left the port under the jurisdiction of Suzhou on the four vessels, each of which lost sight of other vessels in a storm on the East China Sea.
In the tenth month of the same year, the party left the port under the jurisdiction of Suzhou on four vessels; however, they were caught in a storm in the East China Sea and lost sight of each other.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In the tenth month of the same year, the party left the port under the jurisdiction of Suzhou on four vessels; however, they were caught in a storm in the East China Sea and lost sight of each other.

sen.j: 大使多治比広成の乗る第1船のみがかろうじて種子島に漂着したが、残りの船は行方知れずであった。
sen.e: Only the first vessel, which carried the ambassador TAJIHI no Hironari, was cast up on the coast of Tanegashima Island, but the other vessels disappeared.
Only the first vessel carrying the ambassador TAJIHI no Hironari washed ashore on Tanegashima Island, but the other vessels were nowhere to be seen.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Only the first vessel carrying the ambassador TAJIHI no Hironari washed ashore on Tanegashima Island, but the other vessels were nowhere to be seen.

sen.j: 実は副使・中臣名代の乗る第2船は福建方面に漂着し、長安に送り返された。
sen.e: The second vessel, which carried the vice-ambassador NAKATOMI no Nashiro, was cast up on the coast of Fujian Province and they were sent back to Changan.
In fact, the second vessel carrying the vice-ambassador NAKATOMI no Nashiro washed ashore on the coast of Fujian Province, and was sent back to Changan.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In fact, the second vessel carrying the vice-ambassador NAKATOMI no Nashiro washed ashore on the coast of Fujian Province, and was sent back to Changan.

sen.j: 「冊府玄亀」には開元23年（735年）3月日本国使来朝とある。
sen.e: Sappu genki' describes that the Japanese embassy visited the emperor of Tang in the third month of the 23rd year of Kaigen era (735.)
According to "Prime Tortoise of the Record Bureau," the Japanese envoys visited the emperor of Tang China in the third month of the 23rd year of Kaigen era (735).
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: According to "Prime Tortoise of the Record Bureau," the Japanese envoys visited the emperor of Tang China in the third month of the 23rd year of Kaigen era (735).

sen.j: 副使一行は唐朝の援助で船を修理し、8月には奈良の都に帰着することができた。
sen.e: The party of the vice-ambassador had their vessel repaired with the aid of the Tang dynasty, and succeeded in arriving at the Japanese capital Nara in the eighth month of the year.
The party led by the vice-ambassador had their vessel repaired with the aid of the Tang dynasty, and succeeded in arriving in the ancient capital of Nara in the eighth month of the year.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: The party led by the vice-ambassador had their vessel repaired with the aid of the Tang dynasty, and succeeded in arriving in the ancient capital of Nara in the eighth month of the year.

sen.j: この一行は唐人の楽師ら3人、ペルシャ人1人を伴っていた。
sen.e: The party brought three Chinese musicians and a Persian to Japan.
The party brought three Chinese musicians and a Persian to Japan.
The party brought three Chinese musicians and a Persian to Japan.

sen.j: 判官・平群広成の乗る第3船はそれほど幸運ではなかった。
sen.e: The third vessel, which carried HEGURI no Hironari, the administrative officer, was not fortunate as these two vessels.
The Hangan HEGURI no Hironari on the third vessel was not as fortunate as others.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: The Hangan HEGURI no Hironari on the third vessel was not as fortunate as others.

sen.j: いつまでも潮の流れのままに南へ南へと流された。
sen.e: The current carried the vessel southward for ever and ever.
The current carried the vessel southward forever and ever.
sen.cmt: for ever を forever へ変更しました。
sen.e: The current carried the vessel southward forever and ever.

sen.j: 恐らく帆も梶も破損したのだろう。
sen.e: The vessel might have had its helm and sails broken.
The helm and sails were more than likely broken as well.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: The helm and sails were more than likely broken as well.

sen.j: 第4船の行方は全く不明である。
sen.e: The fourth vessel completely disappeared.
No one knows about the fourth vessel.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: No one knows about the fourth vessel.

sen.j: 海中に沈没したか南海の地に漂着し動けなくなったと思われる。
sen.e: It is supposed the fourth vessel must have sunk or drifted ashore somewhere in the southern sea and broken.
It seems like the fourth vessel sank into the ocean or washed ashore somewhere in the southern sea and broke down.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: It seems like the fourth vessel sank into the ocean or washed ashore somewhere in the southern sea and broke down.

sen.j: ある日広成の船はようやく岸辺に流れ着いた。
sen.e: One day, the third vessel, which carried HEGURI no Hironari, was cast ashore.
One day, the third vessel carrying HEGURI no Hironari was finally washed ashore.
sen.cmt: 「ようやく」の訳を補足しました。
sen.e: One day, the third vessel carrying HEGURI no Hironari was finally washed ashore.

sen.j: 住民の肌の色は黒く、崑崙国だと知れた。
sen.e: Since the inhabitants had dark skin, it was understood that the place was the kingdom of Champa.
Since the inhabitants had dark skin, it was understood that the place was the Kingdom of Champa.
Since the inhabitants had dark skin, it was understood that the place was the Kingdom of Champa.

sen.j: 当時中国では肌の色の黒いマレー人など南方諸国を崑崙と総称していたからである。
sen.e: This is because the southern countries, the homelands of the dark skinned races including the Malay, were collectively called Champa in China in those days.
This is because the southern countries, the homelands of the dark skinned races including the Malay, were collectively called Champa by Chinese in those days.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: This is because the southern countries, the homelands of the dark skinned races including the Malay, were collectively called Champa by Chinese in those days.

sen.j: この時、船には115人がいたというから、漂流中に死んだ者は少なかったようだ。
sen.e: It is said that there were 115 survivors on the vessel, which means that few on the vassel had died during the drifting.
It is said that there were 115 survivors on the vessel, which means that only few had died during the drifting.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: It is said that there were 115 survivors on the vessel, which means that only few had died during the drifting.

sen.j: しかし、日本人が上陸するとたちまち武装した現地兵がやって来た。
sen.e: When the Japanese disembarked, the armored local soldiers rushed at them.
As soon as the Japanese disembarked, the armored local soldiers rushed at them.
sen.cmt: 「たちまち」の訳を補足しました。
sen.e: As soon as the Japanese disembarked, the armored local soldiers rushed at them.

sen.j: 唐への使節であった広成たちには満足な武装など無く、それでなくとも漂流で衰弱した身体では現地兵に太刀打ちできなかった。
sen.e: Since the party including Hironari was the embassy to Tang China, they were not armed enough, and besides, the party was wasted away during the drifting so that they were no match for the soldiers.
Since the party including Hironari was just the envoys to Tang China, they were not armed enough, and besides, they were too weak after the drifting to compete with the local soldiers.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Since the party including Hironari was just the envoys to Tang China, they were not armed enough, and besides, they were too weak after the drifting to compete with the local soldiers.

sen.j: 崑崙兵と戦って死んだ者もいれば、密林に逃げ込んだ者もいた。
sen.e: Some fought the Champa soldiers and were killed, and some took refuge in a thick forest.
Some of them were killed by the Champa soldiers, and another took refuge in the jungle.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Some of them were killed by the Champa soldiers, and another took refuge in the jungle.

sen.j: 残りの90人あまりは崑崙兵に捕らえられ、ほとんどはマラリアで死亡した。
sen.e: About 90 of the party were left and caught by the Champa soldiers, but most of them died of Malaria.
The remaining 90 people were captured by the Champa soldiers, but most of them died of Malaria.
sen.cmt: 「残りの」の訳を補足し、「捕らえられる」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: The remaining 90 people were captured by the Champa soldiers, but most of them died of Malaria.

sen.j: 生き残ったのは平群広成と水手3人だけだった。
sen.e: Only three of them survived: HEGURI no Hironari and sailors.
Only HEGURI no Hironari and three other kako (sailors) survived.
sen.cmt: 水手は3人であったと読みそのように訳しました。
sen.e: Only HEGURI no Hironari and three other kako (sailors) survived.

sen.j: 彼らは崑崙の都に連行され、崑崙王に拝謁して抑留された。
sen.e: They took to the capital of Champa to have an audience with the King of Champa and were kept in custody.
They were taken to the capital of Champa to have an audience with the King of Champa and kept in custody.
sen.cmt: 「連行され」の部分を受身に変更しました。
sen.e: They were taken to the capital of Champa to have an audience with the King of Champa and kept in custody.

sen.j: 735年になって唐国欽州（現・中華人民共和国広西チワン族自治区欽州、トンキン湾に面する）在住の崑崙商人に助けられ、欽州へ脱出することができた。
sen.e: In 735, a Champa merchant, who lived in Qinzhou in Tang China, helped them to escape to Qinzhou (present Qinzhou in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region of People's Republic of China, facing the Gulf of Tonkin.)

In 735, a Champa merchant, who lived in Qinzhou in Tang China, helped them to escape to Qinzhou (present Qinzhou in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region of People's Republic of China, facing the Gulf of Tonkin.)

In 735, a Champa merchant, who lived in Qinzhou in Tang China, helped them to escape to Qinzhou (present Qinzhou in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region of People's Republic of China, facing the Gulf of Tonkin.)

sen.j: 欽州には長安から派遣された刺史が駐在しており、広成らは官府の援助で長安の都に送還されている。
sen.e: Since Provincial Governor dispatched from Changan was stationed in Qinzhou, Hironari and sailors were sent back to the capital Changan with the help of the Chinese government.
There was a Provincial Governor sent from Changan residing in Qinzhou, and Hironari and the sailors were sent back to the capital of Changan with the help of the Chinese government.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: There was a Provincial Governor sent from Changan residing in Qinzhou, and Hironari and the sailors were sent back to the capital of Changan with the help of the Chinese government.

sen.j: 平群広成一行が漂着した崑崙をチャンパ王国と断定する理由はいくつかあるが、特に欽州到着後、知らせを受けた唐の宰相・張九齢が起草した「勅日本国王書」（全唐文巻287）に「広成等飄至林邑国」と明瞭に述べていることが決定的である。
sen.e: The most decisive reason among the several reasons for affirming that the place where the party of Hironari drifted ashore was the Kingdom of Champa is that 'Choku Nipponkoku osho' (Vol. 287, all written in Chinese), which was drafted by Tang Prime Minister Zhang Jiu Ling when he was reported on Hironari and others as they arrived at Qinzhou, positively describes that 'Hironari and others drifted to the Kingdom of Lin Yi.'

Although there are several reasons why the place where the party led by HEGURI no Hironari drifted ashore can be identified as the Kingdom of Champa, the most conclusive reason is that "Nihonkokuo ni shokusuru no sho" (Vol. 287, all written in Chinese), drafted by Tang Prime Minister Zhang Jiuling who was notified of the arrival of Hironari and others at Qinzhou, clearly describes that "Hironari and others drifted to Lin-yi."
sen.cmt: ①「勅日本国王書」の読みは（にほんこくおうにちょくするのしょ）のようです。 ②文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Although there are several reasons why the place where the party led by HEGURI no Hironari drifted ashore can be identified as the Kingdom of Champa, the most conclusive reason is that "Nihonkokuo ni shokusuru no sho" (Vol. 287, all written in Chinese), drafted by Tang Prime Minister Zhang Jiuling who was notified of the arrival of Hironari and others at Qinzhou, clearly describes that "Hironari and others drifted to Lin-yi."

sen.j: 林邑とはチャンパ王国の中国名である。
sen.e: Lin-yi is the Chinese name of the Kingdom of Champa.
The Kingdom of Champa was called Lin Yi in Chinese.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: The Kingdom of Champa was called Lin Yi in Chinese.

sen.j: なお、この勅書は中臣名代一行が日本に持ち帰り、平群広成生存の事実は日本でも知られていた。
sen.e: Since this imperial letter was brought to Japan by the party of NAKATOMI no Nashiro, the fact that HEGURI no Hironari was surviving was known in Japan.
Since this chokusho (official document issued by the Emperor) had been brought to Japan by the party led by NAKATOMI no Nashiro, the existence of HEGURI no Hironari was known even in Japan.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Since this chokusho (official document issued by the Emperor) had been brought to Japan by the party led by NAKATOMI no Nashiro, the existence of HEGURI no Hironari was known even in Japan.

tit.cmt: Theを文頭に補足しました。

sen.j: 長安では帰国せずに唐朝に仕えていた阿倍仲麻呂（中国名、朝衡）がおり、帰国の方途を探ってくれた。
sen.e: ABE no Nakamaro (Chinese name Chao Heng), who was in Changan and serving the Tang dynasty instead of having returned to Japan, sought to send those including Hironari back to Japan.
ABE no Nakamaro (Chinese name Chao Heng), who remained in Changan to serve the Tang dynasty, sought a way to send Hironari and others back to Japan.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: ABE no Nakamaro (Chinese name Chao Heng), who remained in Changan to serve the Tang dynasty, sought a way to send Hironari and others back to Japan.

sen.j: 当時は新羅が最も頻繁に長安に朝貢しており、普通なら新羅経由で帰国するのが近道だが、遣唐使発遣の事情を考えてみれば、日本と新羅は開戦する可能性もあり、新羅経由は取れなかった。
sen.e: Although the route through Silla was the fastest way to Japan in those days because Silla sent envoys to Changan to bring tribute to the emperor of Tang most frequently among other countries, the route through Silla was out of question at that time because Japan were to start a war against Silla based on the purpose of the envoys including Hironari.

In those days, Silla was sending the envoys to Changan to give tribute to the emperor of Tang most frequently among other countries, and under normal conditions, the route via Silla was the fastest way to Japan; however, it was out of the question because there was a possibility of war between Japan and Silla in consideration of the purpose of sending the envoys to Tang China.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In those days, Silla was sending the envoys to Changan to give tribute to the emperor of Tang most frequently among other countries, and under normal conditions, the route via Silla was the fastest way to Japan; however, it was out of the question because there was a possibility of war between Japan and Silla in consideration of the purpose of sending the envoys to Tang China.

sen.j: やがて唐と和解した渤海の使節が長安に来るようになり、渤海なら日本との関係も良好だったので、阿倍仲麻呂は広成らが渤海経由で帰国できるよう唐玄宗 (唐)に上奏し、裁可された。
sen.e: In the meantime, Bokkai recovered relations with Tang China and began visiting Changan; since Japan had maintained good relations with Bokkai, ABE no Nakamaro submitted a request to send Hironari and sailors back to Japan through Bokkai to Tang Xuan-Zong and sanctioned.

In the meantime, Bokkai improved relations with Tang China and began sending the envoys to Changan; since Japan had maintained good relations with Bokkai, ABE no Nakamaro requested the Emperor Xuanzong of Tang to send Hironari and others back to Japan through Bokkai, which was approved.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In the meantime, Bokkai improved relations with Tang China and began sending the envoys to Changan; since Japan had maintained good relations with Bokkai, ABE no Nakamaro requested the Emperor Xuanzong of Tang to send Hironari and others back to Japan through Bokkai, which was approved.

sen.j: つまり唐朝が日本人の帰国経費を支給したのである。
sen.e: That means the Tang dynasty paid for the Japanese people to return to Japan.
In other words, the Tang dynasty paid the expenses to send those Japanese back home.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: In other words, the Tang dynasty paid the expenses to send those Japanese back home.

sen.j: こうして開元26年（738年）10月、広成ら遣唐使生き残りの一行は山東半島の登州から海路渤海入りを果たした。
sen.e: In the tenth month of the 26th year of Kaigen era (738,) the survivors on the vessel to Tang China including Hironari entered Bokkai across the sea from Dengzhou on the Shandong peninsula.
Thus, in the tenth month of the 26th year of Kaigen era (738), Hironari and other survivors of envoys took sea route to Bokkai from Dengzhou on the Shandong peninsula.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Thus, in the tenth month of the 26th year of Kaigen era (738), Hironari and other survivors of envoys took sea route to Bokkai from Dengzhou on the Shandong peninsula.

sen.j: この時、渤海では折しも大武芸王が没し、大欽茂が即位したばかりであった。
sen.e: Just at that time, the king Bugei DAI died and Kinmo DAI succeeded the throne in Bokkai.
This happened to coincide with a time when the king Bugei DAI died and Kinmo DAI just succeeded to the throne in Bokkai.
sen.cmt: ①「折しも～した」の訳を補足しました。 ②「即位する」succeed to the throneへ変更しました。
sen.e: This happened to coincide with a time when the king Bugei DAI died and Kinmo DAI just succeeded to the throne in Bokkai.

sen.j: 当時の渤海の都はまだ上京龍泉府（現・中国黒竜江省牡丹江市）ではなく、東牟山（現・中国吉林省延辺朝鮮族自治州敦化市）にあった。
sen.e: The capital of Bokkai was not in ShangJing LongQuanFu yet (present Mudanjiang City, Heilongjiang, China); it was still at Dongmu Mountain (present Dunhua Shi, Yanbian Korean Autonomous prefecture in Jilin province.)

The capital of Bokkai, back then, was not in Shangjing Longquanfu yet (present Mudanjiang City, Heilongjiang Province, China); it was still at Dongmu Mountain (present Dunhua City, Yanbian Korean Autonomous prefecture in Jilin Province, in China).
sen.cmt: 「当時の」の訳を補足しました。
sen.e: The capital of Bokkai, back then, was not in Shangjing Longquanfu yet (present Mudanjiang City, Heilongjiang Province, China); it was still at Dongmu Mountain (present Dunhua City, Yanbian Korean Autonomous prefecture in Jilin Province, in China).

sen.j: 渤海では新王の即位を知らせるために日本に使者を派遣する準備を進めているところであり、広成には日本の使者が迎えに来るまで待てばどうかと勧めたが、広成はすぐにも帰国したいと申し出た。
sen.e: Although the government of Bokkai said to Hironari that they were preparing for the envoys to Japan to announce the enthronement of the new emperor and suggested that he should have waited for the Japanese envoys to come, Hironari insisted on returning to Japan as soon as possible.

It happened that the government of Bokkai was preparing to send the envoys to Japan to announce the enthronement of the new emperor, and suggested Hironari to wait for the Japanese envoys to come; however, Hironari insisted on returning to Japan as soon as possible.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: It happened that the government of Bokkai was preparing to send the envoys to Japan to announce the enthronement of the new emperor, and suggested Hironari to wait for the Japanese envoys to come; however, Hironari insisted on returning to Japan as soon as possible.

sen.j: 出航地の記載はないが、恐らく塩州（現・ロシア領ポシェット湾）であったと思われる。
sen.e: No record on the port they left has been found yet, but it was supposedly the port of Enshu (present the Pochette port in the territory of Russia.)
No record on the port they left has been found yet, but it was supposedly the port of Enshu (present the Pochette port in the territory of Russia.)
No record on the port they left has been found yet, but it was supposedly the port of Enshu (present the Pochette port in the territory of Russia.)

sen.j: 渤海の遣日使節は2隻の船に分乗し、日本海を南下したが、途中1隻が大波を受けて転覆し、大使らが溺死した。
sen.e: The Bokkai envoys to Japan sailed out for Japan on two vessels, and while they were sailing southward on the Sea of Japan, a big wave overturned one of the vessels, causing the the ambassador and others to drown.
Although the Bokkai envoys to Japan sailed southward into the Sea of Japan on two vessels, a big wave overturned one of the vessels and drowned those including the ambassador.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Although the Bokkai envoys to Japan sailed southward into the Sea of Japan on two vessels, a big wave overturned one of the vessels and drowned those including the ambassador.

sen.j: 別の船に乗船していた広成は危いところを免れ、ようやく天平11年（739年）7月出羽国に到着し、副使・已珎蒙らとともに10月になって奈良の都に入った。
sen.e: Hironari, who was on the other vessel, had a narrow escape, and in August 739, managed to arrive at Dewa Province; in November 739, he entered the capital Nara with the Bokkai envoys including the vice-ambassador 已珎蒙.

sen.j: 本文の記述は続日本紀に所収されている、この時の平群広成の報告書を史料としている。
sen.e: This description is based on the report made by HEGURI no Hironari in those days, which was contained in Shoku Nihongi.

sen.j: その後の広成
sen.e: Hironari after that
Hironari in later life
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Hironari in later life

sen.j: 留学生ではなく遣唐使の判官とはいえ、6年もの間海外諸国を渡り歩いた平群広成は当時の日本では屈指の知識人であり、朝廷から重用された。
sen.e: Although not as a student but as an administrative officer, Hironari, who had travelled across several countries for six years, was a preeminent intellectual in Japan in those days so that he was appointed an important position from the Imperial Court.

Although not as a student but as a hangan of the envoys to Tang China, Hironari, who had traveled across several countries for six years, was one of the best intellectuals in Japan in those days and appointed an important position from the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: ①" traveled" のスペルを米語のスペルに修正しました。②「屈指の～」の意味合いがでるように変更しました。
sen.e: Although not as a student but as a hangan of the envoys to Tang China, Hironari, who had traveled across several countries for six years, was one of the best intellectuals in Japan in those days and appointed an important position from the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 帰国後の広成は、漂流生活で得た知識を存分に活用して朝廷に仕え、さしたる失態もなく順調に出世していく。
sen.e: After returning to Japan, Hironari served the Imperial Court by making the best use of the knowledge he got through drifting, and moved up the ladder without any blunder.
After returning to Japan, Hironari served the Imperial Court by making the best use of the knowledge he gained through drifting, and moved up the ladder without any blunders.

sen.e: After returning to Japan, Hironari served the Imperial Court by making the best use of the knowledge he gained through drifting, and moved up the ladder without any blunders.

sen.j: 帰国直後に藤原広嗣の乱が起こったが、天平15年（743年）刑部大輔を拝命し、天平16年（744年）東山道使、天平16年（746年）式部大輔、同年攝津大夫に任命され、天平19年（747年）正月従四位下、天平勝宝2年（750年）従四位上と累進し、天平勝宝4年（752年）には武蔵守に任命されている。
sen.e: After his return to Japan, the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu broke out; in 743, he was appointed Senior Assistant Minister of Justice; in 744, appointed official envoy to Tosando; in 746, appointed Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial; in 746, appointed the governor of Settsu; and in January 747, raised to Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade; and in 750, raised to Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade; and in 752, appointed Provincial Governor of Musashi.

sen.j: 武蔵国は大国であり、普通なら平群氏の家格ではなれないところである。
sen.e: Musashi Province was a big province so that the Heguri clan of its social standing in those days could not have produced the governor of the province.
Since Musashi Province was the largest province in the region, it was, under ordinary circumstances, the last place the Heguri clan with their own social standing to produce a governor.

sen.j: この間、広成は遣唐留学生出身・吉備真備が権勢に昇り、失脚するのを見てきた。
sen.e: During the period, Hironari had seen that KIBI no Makibi, who studied in Tang China as a student, held an influential position and fell from the power.

sen.j: 天平勝宝5年（753年）1月28日従四位上・武蔵守で没し、波瀾万丈の生涯に幕を閉じた。
sen.e: On March 11, 753, Hironari died as Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, the provincial governor of Musashi, which was the end of his life full of vicissitudes.
On March 11, 753, Hironari died as Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, the Governor of Musashi Province, which was the end of his extraordinary life.
